text.p: Following are the main stories in Croatian newspapers on Tuesday.
- The return of confiscated property will cost more than $11 billion.
- Is the Croatian Peasant's Party (HSS) to leave the Zagreb opposition bloc?

- Poor safety situation for Croatian employees in the Beli Manastir outlet of the Croatian office for the issuing of documents to the local population: Will the employees have to wear flak jackets to work?
- Another ten bridges to be built over the Sava river in Zagreb.
- Road rage: A BMW driver shoots a Golf motorist in the very center of Zagreb.
- Croatia is entitled to war damages, says a group of the Zagreb Law School professors. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
